title: Random Access Property

description.core_idea: Arrays allow direct access to any element using its index without iterating over previous elements.
explanation: Because elements are contiguous and have fixed size, the memory address can be calculated instantly.
Accessing arr[i] requires only base_address + (i Ã— element_size).
No scanning or traversal is needed.

examples: arr[5] can be accessed directly from memory using its offset.
In contrast, linked lists require traversal to reach the 5th element.
common_misconceptions: Accessing a later element requires scanning all previous elements
Random access means data is shuffled in memory
